description:
From cactus release on OpenStack API, would like to see addressed ASAP:

Public IP in a list of private:

{"server"=>
  {"name"=>"kd_test_3",
   "flavorRef"=>"http://50.56.22.22:8774/v1.1/flavors/3",
   "addresses"=>
    {"public"=>[], "private"=>[{"version"=>4, "addr"=>"50.56.22.25"}]},
   "metadata"=>{"v2"=>"d2", "4"=>"14", "5"=>"17"},

   "imageRef"=>"http://50.56.22.22:8774/v1.1/images/1",
   "id"=>26,
   "hostId"=>"4e6200284bc7bd28e49016aa047fbdc6a3f57e59612ec1be831ce9dd",
   "links"=>
    [{"href"=>"http://50.56.22.22:8774/v1.1/servers/26", "rel"=>"self"},
     {"href"=>"http://50.56.22.22:8774/v1.1/servers/26",

      "rel"=>"bookmark",
      "type"=>"application/json"},
     {"href"=>"http://50.56.22.22:8774/v1.1/servers/26",
      "rel"=>"bookmark",
      "type"=>"application/xml"}],
   "status"=>"ACTIVE"}}
title: public Server addresses are kept in a list of private addresses while the publist list is empt

comments.content:
From cactus release on OpenStack API, would like to see addressed ASAP:

Public IP in a list of private:

{"server"=>
  {"name"=>"kd_test_3",
   "flavorRef"=>"http://50.56.22.22:8774/v1.1/flavors/3",
   "addresses"=>
    {"public"=>[], "private"=>[{"version"=>4, "addr"=>"50.56.22.25"}]},
   "metadata"=>{"v2"=>"d2", "4"=>"14", "5"=>"17"},

   "imageRef"=>"http://50.56.22.22:8774/v1.1/images/1",
   "id"=>26,
   "hostId"=>"4e6200284bc7bd28e49016aa047fbdc6a3f57e59612ec1be831ce9dd",
   "links"=>
    [{"href"=>"http://50.56.22.22:8774/v1.1/servers/26", "rel"=>"self"},
     {"href"=>"http://50.56.22.22:8774/v1.1/servers/26",

      "rel"=>"bookmark",
      "type"=>"application/json"},
     {"href"=>"http://50.56.22.22:8774/v1.1/servers/26",
- Hide quoted text -

      "rel"=>"bookmark",
      "type"=>"application/xml"}],
   "status"=>"ACTIVE"}}
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~shivan-rightscale

comments.content: Looks like part of your message was hidden. Could you attach the json file containing evidence of the bug ?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx

comments.content: Thanks Thierry - mistake with copy and paste - I fixed the above and will also attach a file.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~shivan-rightscale

comments.content: Could you explain in more detail what the bug is ? From where I stand, 50.56.22.25 appears to be a private address listed in the server/addresses...
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx

comments.content:
The issue is that the 50.56.22.25 IP address is one of 10 IP addresses that are public IPs in this cloud set up.  However, it is listed as private in the api response instead of in the proper public list.  It looks like public IPs are not being returned in the proper list.

Is this not reproducible by others?  Seems easy to reproduce on our side...

Thanks!
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~shivan-rightscale

comments.content: Hmm, I think there is a misunderstanding around what "public IP" means in that context. Reading nova/api/openstack/views/addresses.py, apparently public IPs in that OpenStack API call are floating IPs that are manually associated to the instance... and private IPs are "regular" IPs handed out by nova-network...
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx

comments.content: You're right, Thierry. At some point, we need to expose the addresses grouped by the actual networks they reside in.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~bcwaldon

comments.content: So this looks invalid to me -- please reopen if you disagree.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx

comments.content: Yeah, unfortunately this is expected behavior. Will be addressed in Diablo.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~bcwaldon
